comments.commentBody:
And in my head, that always leads to Carl Sandburg:

I am the grass.
Let me work.
When oh when does anyone in the commercial media start to probe Trumps' airy bluster?
I sure did.
Agreed. Lauer is a lightweight. The Ron Popeil of network "news".
Weatv: Yes, and a big smile. But Lauer stuck it to Trump on the "I know more than the generals" piece. Also on "taking the oil."

Did anyone else notice the back slap Mr. Lauer gave Trump just before he sat down? As in, "don't worry, I'll go easy on you; no challenging follow-ups; no tight spots like the ones I put Clinton in."

Network morning news lightweight living down to expectations, as usual.
Matt Lauer is a light-weight. He should never have been given this job.

Trump's performance tonight was wanting as ever.  Encores of "make America great again," a tweak that we should "make America strong again," and the leap that the fortune he has made in his business is in any way connected to being our President.

I'm starting to wonder if the Russians, or the Chinese, have released some terrible toxin or virus into the foodstuffs consumed by our government officials, something highly contagious, which retards their already mediocre intellect, foisting on us the two not funny fools, vying to be our President.

The government of the United States of America is currently providing everyone on the planet with daily doses of its inanity.
No, once you sign into your account it's all there.

"I learned tonight that Ms. Clinton is singularly to blame and solely responsible for getting us into Iraq,..."

No one said anything about "singularly responsible", but thanks for the spin.

However, she is responsible for her decision to take billions from the same neoconservative oligarchs that pushed us into the Iraq War, and were indeed behind her rational, which tells us she cares about power and wealth, and not the $ 6 Trillion and counting it cost our nation, the over 4,500 dead Americans and the 10s of thousands of injured veterans.

But apparently, that's just dandy as far as her supporters are concerned.

HRC has been gone from her role as Sec of State for nearly 4 years. Why would the intelligence briefing which is supposed to be what's happening here and now have ANYTHING to do with her?

This man is an idiot. I'd say he thinks we are too but he's really not bright enough to make that connection.

"Mr. Trump chose to answer a question about the confidential national security briefings that he has recently begun to receive — a topic that presidents and presidential candidates rarely discuss with any openness.... Mr. Trump, asked if he learned anything alarming, said, “There was one thing that shocked me” and suggested that it involved a decision by President Obama and Mrs. Clinton that amounted to “a total disaster.”"

WHY WAS HE ASKED A question for which his answer is impossible to verify???

Trump was tossed soft balls, while Hillary received two-by-fours up side her head.
If Matt Lauer is the best at being impartial and challenging both candidates equally  these will be sham debates.

Not only did Clinton answer questions with facts, figures, historical and geopolitical context... she was repeatedly cut off by Matt while she did so.

"Liberal Media", indeed.
Please frame your comment. It is perfection. Sadly.

We are truly doomed if this is the level at which the candidates will be addressed during the debates.

"Hilary, please spend the next 2 hours apologizing for your emails."

"Donald, the floor is yours. Say what you like. It would be rude to fact check."

Trump has a secret plan for ISIS. Conveniently not fact checkable.

The intelligence briefings revealed a distaste for Obama by the intelligence services. I guess they like Putin better too. Conveniently not fact checkable and possibly a coded message for his BFF Vladimir.

He loves, absolutely loves Putin. Because he said the Donald was brilliant. That proves Putin is smart, fair, reasonable, and willing to follow Trump's orders. Boy, this foreign policy stuff is easy.

He will order the generals to give him a plan in 30 days. That's a great idea. I'm sure they aren't even thinking about it at this moment.

Mix women and men together and of course you get rape. Beyond comment.

If only Hilary said he was brilliant--then he would vote for her.
Lauer is a clown.  Haranguing Clinton for saying that Iraq is a mistake because the veterans who suffered in Iraq would feel bad??  She's right that it was wrong. Bush and Cheney lied.
I am not entirely unsympathetic to your views.  But, Trump! Come on. His incoherence in foreign policy and downright racism and xenophobia, ought to give any one pause.

A "secret" plan. This sounds exactly like Nixon and his secret plan regarding Vietnam. Did anything that Nixon say amount to a kernel of truth? Nope. Does anything on ANY subject amount to a kernel of truth from Trump. Nope. Let's not waste our time impeaching this liar and cheat.

Well, despite Matt Lauer's best efforts Donald Trump proved quick tongued and difficult to trap in an obvious or at least specified gaffe. Hillary answered questions in her usual informed and cogent manner but I really don't think this format won her points or did her any favors. I look forward to one-on-one debates as long as they're well controlled.
Sen Flake, to his everlasting credit, has refused to endorse DT. A shame McCain hasn't done the same.

Thank goodness Clinton is now leading here in AZ.

In McCain's recent lengthy primary victory speech last Tuesday, he talked about the future general election. Standing next to him was Senator Jeff Flake.

Not once was Trump's name mentioned.

Even in AZ, Trump has become "he who must not be named" for some of those seeking reelection.
Great. Thank you.

If Donald Trump says he would have flown home after the "stairs" incident in China, I suppose that means that a thin- skinned President Donald might have "sent in the Marines" after a personal slur like that delivered by the Philippine's President Duerte to Barack Obama. President Obama knows how to rise above petty insults and act appropriately while I shudder to think how Trump would react as POTUS faced with these types of incidents.

Listening to Trump makes me even more appreciative of President Obama.  Trump disparaged the President again for accepting that there was no staircase brought to Air Force One in China (Trump has previously said that he would have flown back home).  Being the President and Commander-in-Chief are not about grandstanding and pettiness.  Trump, unlike Obama, is about ego and showmanship, not about leadership and governance.

There was an earlier story written by a different reporter that mentioned both the Putin comments and the rape in the military comments. It was replaced by this article. Here are both articles for comparison.http://newsdiffs.org/diff/1245445/1245474/www.nytimes.com/2016/09/08/us/...

How does this story not mention Trump praising Putin and saying he'd be a better leader than Obama? In any other year that would be a campaign-destroying scandal, warranting a quick retraction and apology.

Were we watching the same event?
And, unless I'm wrong, disclosed details of his intelligence briefing.  Honestly, Trump.

Debate? You're actually calling that hot mess a debate? It was supposed to be about vets issues. Seventeen minutes of Lauer on the Clinton emails; hoping to boost his career with a gotcha question followed by another fact free 30 minutes traversing Trump's ego. I suppose he's qualified on vets issues because there's an (I) in military. Another journalistic face plant brought to you by corporate media where our news people don't report the news, they are the news.

@WestSider: In case you haven't heard, ISIS is pretty much done in Libya.  That organization now controls only two or three neighborhoods in the city of Surt and they're about to be run out of that city as well.  Hillary (and the President) might have considered all possible outcomes before instituting their bombing campaign to stop Qaddafi but evidence shows that The Donald (among others) was urging them to take action at the time and, in any case, when you're confronted with a situation involving incipient massacre it's hard to just sit still and watch it happen.

Dear JC,

I read the article and I saw nowhere that he "recommended" a private email server. What he told her was that he had a laptop with a private email account (not the same as a private email server) and that he did his personal business on it but occasionally some government emails also were sent.

He was clear he did not like having the State Department trying to control his correspondence or his movements, but he did not recommend she set up a private server.

SoS Clinton kept 100% of her official State Department email on a private server. I have heard her various reasons, which all seem pretty weak, but accusing Colin Powell of advising her to do it is really sort sophomoric. I did it because someone else told me to, even when the State Department told me not to. Please, talk about spinning and spinning. Her prevarications make one dizzy.

Looks like Powell did recommend a private email server to Clinton.More GOP lies. Who would have ever suspected such a thing?

http://www.cnn.com/2016/09/07/politics/hillary-clinton-colin-powell-emai...

I agree it was totally inappropriate, including the attack on the mother.  Although it is weird that Hillary would feature a family whose child died in the war she supported.  If she had joined the other courageous representatives like Ted Kennedy, Jim Jeffords, Paul Wellstone, etc. in opposing Iraq from the get-go, it would have made more sense.

Good for Hillary Clinton that she brought up how inappropriate it was for Trump to feud with the Khans.  No credible Commander-in-Chief should ever insult a gold-star mother by speculating that her religion forbade her from speaking.
